title: Rewrite AltFinder in native Swift/SwiftUI
description:
Rewrite the Electron/React/TypeScript file browser as a native macOS app using Swift and SwiftUI for better performance and native feel.

## Current Stack (to replace)
- Electron 39 + React 19 + TypeScript
- Tailwind CSS
- Vite build system
- electron-store for persistence

## Target Stack
- Swift 5.9+ / SwiftUI
- AppKit integration for Finder-like behavior
- UserDefaults/Core Data for persistence
- Native macOS file APIs

## Features to Preserve
- File browser with sortable columns (Name, Date Modified, Size, Kind)
- Breadcrumb navigation with back/forward history
- Pinned files/folders using .altfinder.json manifests
- File operations: copy, cut, paste, rename, delete to trash, create folder
- Context menu with quick actions
- Search/filter in current directory
- Hidden files toggle
- Dark/light mode support
- Window state persistence
- Keyboard shortcuts (Cmd+C, Cmd+X, Cmd+V, Cmd+Shift+N, etc.)
- Security-scoped bookmarks for tracking pinned files across renames

## Goals
- Native performance (no Chromium overhead)
- Native look and feel
- Smaller app size
- Better system integration
close_reason: Implemented native Swift/SwiftUI version in AltFinderSwift/ directory. App builds and runs successfully with all major features: file browsing, navigation, pinned files, file operations, context menu, search, and keyboard shortcuts.

title: Load actual Finder favorites in sidebar instead of hardcoded locations
description:
The Swift version's sidebar only shows hardcoded standard locations (Home, Desktop, Documents, Downloads, Applications). It doesn't show the user's actual Finder favorites like their 'code' folder.

The Electron version was also having this issue recently.

Need to:
1. Read the user's actual Finder Favorites from macOS (LSSharedFileList or similar API)
2. Display them in the Favorites section instead of/in addition to hardcoded paths
3. Investigate what changed in the Electron version that broke this
close_reason: Added FinderFavoritesService that reads actual Finder favorites from ~/Library/Application Support/com.apple.sharedfilelist/com.apple.LSSharedFileList.FavoriteItems.sfl3 using NSKeyedUnarchiver. Includes file watching for live updates.

title: Fix large gap between column headers and file list
description:
There's excessive empty space between the column headers (Name, Date Modified, Size, Kind) and the actual file list in the Swift version. The headers appear at the top but there's a huge vertical gap before files appear.

Likely cause: Layout issue in FileListView.swift where the header and ScrollView aren't properly connected, or there's extra spacing/padding.
close_reason: Fixed by adding frame alignment modifiers to LazyVStack and ScrollView
